title: Come join us for our Game Awards 2024 liveblog
description: Tonight is The Game Awards 2024, the first since Geoff Keighley killed E3 and consumed its heart in front of a group of screaming schoolchildren. Just saying, this had better be good, Geoff, especially after the 2023 showâ€™s "embarrassing" shooing-off of developers whose acceptance speeches cut into that valuable trailer showcase time. Who will need to please wrap it up this time? Which games will be revealed? Will there be a musical number to top last yearâ€™s Herald of Darkness performance? (That was fun, actually, fair play on that one.) You can find out right along with us, as we once again fire up the RPS liveblog-o-tron to report all the developments as they happen. Even the ones that happen at 3:45am, when Iâ€™ll be desperately trying not to collapse into my keyboard like a felled tree. Read more
author: James Archer
excerpt: We're liveblogging The Game Awards 2024. Care to join us?
text: From 12:30am GMT / 7:30pm ET Live Image credit: The Game Awards Tonight is The Game Awards 2024, the first since Geoff Keighley killed E3 and consumed its heart in front of a group of screaming schoolchildren. Just saying, this had better be good, Geoff, especially after the 2023 showâ€™s "embarrassing" shooing-off of developers whose acceptance speeches cut into that valuable trailer showcase time. Who will need to please wrap it up this time? Which games will be revealed? Will there be a musical number to top last yearâ€™s Herald of Darkness performance? (That was fun, actually, fair play on that one.) You can find out right along with us, as we once again fire up the RPS liveblog-o-tron to report all the developments as they happen. Even the ones that happen at 3:45am, when Iâ€™ll be desperately trying not to collapse into my keyboard like a felled tree. Speaking of, said blog will go live just before The Games Awards itself kicks off, at 12:30am GMT / 7:30pm ET / 4:30pm PT. Why not watch along with us using the embedded stream below, and sling us some comments of your own? See you then. ðŸ”´ The Game Awards 2024: Official 4K Livestream - LIVE TODAY! (7:30p ET/4:30p PT/12:30a GMT) Watch on YouTube The Geoffening has begun! Catch all the latest Game Awards announcements on our Game Awards 2024 hub page. You can also get the news hot from our liveblog. Key points 16:22 pm December 12 2024 The Game Awards 2024 liveblog 01:12 am UTC Witcher 4, looks like, starring Ciri. â€“ James Archer 01:11 am UTC New game from CD Projekt Red next. â€“ James Archer 01:08 am UTC Anyway, this Indy love-in is all for the sake of the Best Performance award. It goes to Melinda Juergens, voice of Hellblade 2's Senua, for her role as Hellblade 2's Senua. â€“ James Archer 01:07 am UTC He thinks Troy Baker is a good Harrison Ford, is what I'm getting. â€“ James Archer 01:06 am UTC Harrison Ford is here. I'm hoping he knows *where* here is, but here he is. â€“ James Archer 01:05 am UTC Todd Howard and Troy Baker are presenting something and good grief, is Todd really short or is Troy really tall? â€“ James Archer 01:05 am UTC Will there be two people I'd like to have a beer with less on stage at the same time tonight? The night is young! â€“ Nic Reuben 01:04 am UTC Statler and Waldorf from Sesame Street are doing a bit, for no readily apparent reason. â€“ James Archer 01:03 am UTC Former PlayStation CEO Ken Kutaragi is namedropped, then he gets confused and tries to walk onstage. Deary me. â€“ James Archer 01:02 am UTC Balatro creator LocalThunk is here, as is Sam Lake, who I hope does another dance. â€“ James Archer 01:02 am UTC Solasta II has shiny rock people in it. Why do games keep doing this? I bet they make a limp 'clunk' sound when you hit them. They're everywhere and I hate them so much. â€“ Nic Reuben 01:01 am UTC Also my guilty TGA confession is that I quite like the Linkin Park song he walked out to. I'm sorry. â€“ James Archer 01:01 am UTC He's actually dressed himself properly for this one, to be fair. â€“ James Archer 01:00 am UTC Time for the main event. GEOFF. GEOFF. GEOFF. GEOFF. â€“ James Archer 00:59 am UTC Last trailer of the pre-show is for Solasta 2, a sequel to turn-based RPG Solasta: Crown of the Magister. Entering early access in 2025, with a demo coming soon. â€“ James Archer 00:57 am UTC Here's a football (or "sock her") game from the makers of Sifu, which actually has a similar painterly style. It's called Rematch and is out in 2025. â€“ James Archer 00:55 am UTC Best Family Game goes to Astro Bot, which is not a PC game, but might be in 2026 or so. â€“ James Archer 00:55 am UTC Lil' trailer there for Kyora, a Terraria-esque 2D mining game. â€“ James Archer 00:54 am UTC Here's our Thick as Thieves preview from Jeremy Peel, btw. â€“ James Archer 00:53 am UTC The Innovation in Accessibility award goes to Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown. Good for them. â€“ James Archer 00:52 am UTC Midnight Murder Club next, which looks to be all about offing your friends in a blacked-out mansion. There's a crossplay beta out now. â€“ James Archer 00:51 am UTC I, uh, thought this might be Judas at first. But nah, it's a vaguely cartoonish Stalcraft: Operations. â€“ James Archer 00:49 am UTC Anyway, Cozy K shows a bit of Tales of the Shire, which is out on March 25th 2025. â€“ James Archer 00:48 am UTC Someone who promots cozy games is called Cozy K? Damn, that worked out well â€“ James Archer 00:47 am UTC Games for Impact award next. What does that mean? I dunno, but Neva wins it â€“ James Archer 00:47 am UTC Also a blink-and-you'll miss it trailer for Steel Paws â€“ James Archer 00:46 am UTC Honestly, a big dark Pac Man appears at the end and munches everything â€“ James Archer 00:46 am UTC Another reveal: Shadow Labyrinth, which looks like an edgy cross between 2D platformer and... Pac Man â€“ James Archer 00:45 am UTC Quickfire awards now. League of Legends wins Best Esports Game, Faker wins Best Esports Athlete, and T1 wins Best Esports Team. Absolute League bias, ref â€“ James Archer 00:43 am UTC Multiplayer first-person heist game, looks like? â€“ James Archer 00:43 am UTC Now, the reveal of Thick of Thieves, from Warren "Don't attribute entire games to a single person" Spector â€“ James Archer 00:41 am UTC That's Dave the Diver: In the Jungle, coming 2025. Not sure if that's a DLC or sequel? But Dave goes to the jungle, just fyi â€“ James Archer 00:40 am UTC Something Dave the Diver next, it seems. â€“ James Archer 00:38 am UTC Best VR/AR Game goes to Batman: Arkham Shadow. Am currently emailing Rick Lane to ask if this is deserved or not â€“ James Archer 00:37 am UTC New trailer for Slay the Spire 2, which is (still) coming to early access in 2025. â€“ James Archer 00:35 am UTC One Move Away, it's called. Out in 2025. â€“ James Archer 00:35 am UTC Next is a "cosy game", seemingly about moving house. I actually did this at the weekend and there is literally nothing I don't want to play a game about more. â€“ James Archer 00:34 am UTC First award too. Best Fighting Game goes to Tekken 8. Also hah, I forgot they shunt some of their forty thousand award categories into the pre-show. â€“ James Archer 00:33 am UTC This is Ninja Gaiden Ragebound, a retro-style, side-scrolling ninja fighter from the makers of TMNT: Shredder's Revenge. â€“ James Archer 00:31 am UTC First trailer coming up... â€“ James Archer 00:31 am UTC It's the opening act! Presented by State Farm! Say in the comments if you know what that is â€“ James Archer 00:30 am UTC Would it be unprofessional to get Deliveroo while - oh wait it's starting â€“ James Archer 00:30 am UTC Uh oh. I'm hungry. â€“ James Archer 00:28 am UTC One and a bit minutes to go. The pre-show music is climatically swelling, as if we're about to see a man fight a dragon, rather than one present marketing materials while wearing a blazer with trainers â€“ James Archer 00:21 am UTC Wang Tang says: I never followed the announcements in the past, however, this year I'm excited for some Exodus news - thanks RPS for covering this :) (Coca Cola, for me a classic to stay awake. What more than tons of coffein and sugar to keep you on your toes?) Incidentally, this liveblog is brought to you by the refreshing taste of Diet Coke. Other sugar-free carbonated beverages are available â€“ James Archer 00:20 am UTC I'm up. I'm up. I wasn't sleeping. God, what time is it? â€“ James Archer 16:22 pm UTC The Game Awards 2024 liveblog Hello, early birds. Let's meet back here at 12:30am GMT / 7:30pm ET / 4:30pm PT when the show begins, yes? â€“ James Archer
html:
From 12:30am GMT / 7:30pm ET

Live

Tonight is The Game Awards 2024, the first since Geoff Keighley killed E3 and consumed its heart in front of a group of screaming schoolchildren. Just saying, this had better be good, Geoff, especially after the 2023 showâ€™s "embarrassing" shooing-off of developers whose acceptance speeches cut into that valuable trailer showcase time.

Who will need to please wrap it up this time? Which games will be revealed? Will there be a musical number to top last yearâ€™s Herald of Darkness performance? (That was fun, actually, fair play on that one.) You can find out right along with us, as we once again fire up the RPS liveblog-o-tron to report all the developments as they happen. Even the ones that happen at 3:45am, when Iâ€™ll be desperately trying not to collapse into my keyboard like a felled tree.

Speaking of, said blog will go live just before The Games Awards itself kicks off, at 12:30am GMT / 7:30pm ET / 4:30pm PT. Why not watch along with us using the embedded stream below, and sling us some comments of your own? See you then.

The Geoffening has begun! Catch all the latest Game Awards announcements on our Game Awards 2024 hub page. You can also get the news hot from our liveblog.

Key points

  • 16:22 pm December 12 2024 The Game Awards 2024 liveblog

01:12 am UTC

Witcher 4, looks like, starring Ciri.

â€“ James Archer

01:11 am UTC

New game from CD Projekt Red next.

â€“ James Archer

01:08 am UTC

Anyway, this Indy love-in is all for the sake of the Best Performance award. It goes to Melinda Juergens, voice of Hellblade 2's Senua, for her role as Hellblade 2's Senua.

â€“ James Archer

01:07 am UTC

He thinks Troy Baker is a good Harrison Ford, is what I'm getting.

â€“ James Archer

01:06 am UTC

Harrison Ford is here. I'm hoping he knows *where* here is, but here he is.

â€“ James Archer

01:05 am UTC

Todd Howard and Troy Baker are presenting something and good grief, is Todd really short or is Troy really tall?

â€“ James Archer

01:05 am UTC

Will there be two people I'd like to have a beer with less on stage at the same time tonight? The night is young!

â€“ Nic Reuben

01:04 am UTC

Statler and Waldorf from Sesame Street are doing a bit, for no readily apparent reason.

â€“ James Archer

01:03 am UTC

Former PlayStation CEO Ken Kutaragi is namedropped, then he gets confused and tries to walk onstage. Deary me.

â€“ James Archer

01:02 am UTC

Balatro creator LocalThunk is here, as is Sam Lake, who I hope does another dance.

â€“ James Archer

01:02 am UTC

Solasta II has shiny rock people in it. Why do games keep doing this? I bet they make a limp 'clunk' sound when you hit them. They're everywhere and I hate them so much.

â€“ Nic Reuben

01:01 am UTC

Also my guilty TGA confession is that I quite like the Linkin Park song he walked out to. I'm sorry.

â€“ James Archer

01:01 am UTC

He's actually dressed himself properly for this one, to be fair.

â€“ James Archer

01:00 am UTC

Time for the main event. GEOFF. GEOFF. GEOFF. GEOFF.

â€“ James Archer

00:59 am UTC

Last trailer of the pre-show is for Solasta 2, a sequel to turn-based RPG Solasta: Crown of the Magister. Entering early access in 2025, with a demo coming soon.

â€“ James Archer

00:57 am UTC

Here's a football (or "sock her") game from the makers of Sifu, which actually has a similar painterly style. It's called Rematch and is out in 2025.

â€“ James Archer

00:55 am UTC

Best Family Game goes to Astro Bot, which is not a PC game, but might be in 2026 or so.

â€“ James Archer

00:55 am UTC

Lil' trailer there for Kyora, a Terraria-esque 2D mining game.

â€“ James Archer

00:54 am UTC

Here's our Thick as Thieves preview from Jeremy Peel, btw.

â€“ James Archer

00:53 am UTC

The Innovation in Accessibility award goes to Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown. Good for them.

â€“ James Archer

00:52 am UTC

Midnight Murder Club next, which looks to be all about offing your friends in a blacked-out mansion. There's a crossplay beta out now.

â€“ James Archer

00:51 am UTC

I, uh, thought this might be Judas at first. But nah, it's a vaguely cartoonish Stalcraft: Operations.

â€“ James Archer

00:49 am UTC

Anyway, Cozy K shows a bit of Tales of the Shire, which is out on March 25th 2025.

â€“ James Archer

00:48 am UTC

Someone who promots cozy games is called Cozy K? Damn, that worked out well

â€“ James Archer

00:47 am UTC

Games for Impact award next. What does that mean? I dunno, but Neva wins it

â€“ James Archer

00:47 am UTC

Also a blink-and-you'll miss it trailer for Steel Paws

â€“ James Archer

00:46 am UTC

Honestly, a big dark Pac Man appears at the end and munches everything

â€“ James Archer

00:46 am UTC

Another reveal: Shadow Labyrinth, which looks like an edgy cross between 2D platformer and... Pac Man

â€“ James Archer

00:45 am UTC

Quickfire awards now. League of Legends wins Best Esports Game, Faker wins Best Esports Athlete, and T1 wins Best Esports Team. Absolute League bias, ref

â€“ James Archer

00:43 am UTC

Multiplayer first-person heist game, looks like?

â€“ James Archer

00:43 am UTC

Now, the reveal of Thick of Thieves, from Warren "Don't attribute entire games to a single person" Spector

â€“ James Archer

00:41 am UTC

That's Dave the Diver: In the Jungle, coming 2025. Not sure if that's a DLC or sequel? But Dave goes to the jungle, just fyi

â€“ James Archer

00:40 am UTC

Something Dave the Diver next, it seems.

â€“ James Archer

00:38 am UTC

Best VR/AR Game goes to Batman: Arkham Shadow. Am currently emailing Rick Lane to ask if this is deserved or not

â€“ James Archer

00:37 am UTC

New trailer for Slay the Spire 2, which is (still) coming to early access in 2025.

â€“ James Archer

00:35 am UTC

One Move Away, it's called. Out in 2025.

â€“ James Archer

00:35 am UTC

Next is a "cosy game", seemingly about moving house. I actually did this at the weekend and there is literally nothing I don't want to play a game about more.

â€“ James Archer

00:34 am UTC

First award too. Best Fighting Game goes to Tekken 8. Also hah, I forgot they shunt some of their forty thousand award categories into the pre-show.

â€“ James Archer

00:33 am UTC

This is Ninja Gaiden Ragebound, a retro-style, side-scrolling ninja fighter from the makers of TMNT: Shredder's Revenge.

â€“ James Archer

00:31 am UTC

First trailer coming up...

â€“ James Archer

00:31 am UTC

It's the opening act! Presented by State Farm! Say in the comments if you know what that is

â€“ James Archer

00:30 am UTC

Would it be unprofessional to get Deliveroo while - oh wait it's starting

â€“ James Archer

00:30 am UTC

Uh oh. I'm hungry.

â€“ James Archer

00:28 am UTC

One and a bit minutes to go. The pre-show music is climatically swelling, as if we're about to see a man fight a dragon, rather than one present marketing materials while wearing a blazer with trainers

â€“ James Archer

00:21 am UTC

Wang Tang says: I never followed the announcements in the past, however, this year I'm excited for some Exodus news - thanks RPS for covering this :) (Coca Cola, for me a classic to stay awake. What more than tons of coffein and sugar to keep you on your toes?)

Incidentally, this liveblog is brought to you by the refreshing taste of Diet Coke. Other sugar-free carbonated beverages are available

â€“ James Archer

00:20 am UTC

I'm up. I'm up. I wasn't sleeping. God, what time is it?

â€“ James Archer

16:22 pm UTC

The Game Awards 2024 liveblog

Hello, early birds. Let's meet back here at 12:30am GMT / 7:30pm ET / 4:30pm PT when the show begins, yes?

â€“ James Archer
